column4: How can I create a user that doesn't need a public key to log in with SSH?
You mean with password, or passwordless?
with password, without public key
Did you disabled password login? can you paste message (if -vvv use web paste).
Well it's really an image at Amazon EC2. So it might have been like that by default. Message is simply: Permission denied (publickey).
You log in with password (first user)? Does new user have home directory?
No, I never created a home directory for the user
And old user using password login?
No, first user uses key
No, I want the new user to be able to login without key
Actually, the new user has a home directory I see now
Does it have .ssh directory, and what permissions?
Lemme check
No, home folder empty
You could copy .ssh (with content) from old account and chown it.
Now it looks like this: drwx------ 2 eugene root   4096 2011-04-19 01:07 .ssh
Was wrong: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1454629/aws-ssh-access-permission-denied-publickey-issue
ok, more info: http://serverfault.com/questions/253464/enable-password-login-for-ssh-on-amazon-linux-ami
thanks! that's exactly what I was looking for
